data.title: Heavenly Gnocchi
data.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Northern California.  This unassuming bistro makes melt in your mouth gnocchi in a gorgonzola truffle cream sauce.  Also not to be missed is the house cured salmon appetizer with lemon and peppercorns.  If I am not super hungry I get that and the polenta with mushrooms and melted cheese together for an entree.  Save room for the panna cotta and ice cream with espresso.  Let Gianni pick a glass of wine for you, you will not be disappointed.  Real Italian food with excellent service - don't miss this gem.

data.title: Would not go here again.
data.text: A group of six of us dined at Gianni's on Tuesday, Oct. 18, 2016.  Pork medallions were on the special menu.  I was served pork raw.  The server agreed and brought me another pork medallions plate which was properly cooked.  When I say RAW, the center was red.  Pork needs to be cooked properly and everyone knows how dangerous uncooked pork can be.  Also, the drinks were very expensive.  The bill came and was higher priced for two of us than the menu stated.  The restaurant is very noisy and makes talking with the person or people very difficult at your table.

data.title: Excellent Dinner
data.text: This has become my special restaurant especially for "celebrations".  Not large, but quite intimate. Understand that the chef was working in Danville and decided to open his own Northern Italian restaurant.  The two of us got there early and seated by the window. The pleasant waiter served us a superb Caeser Salad (that we split) followed by a excellent Sauvignon Blanc Wine (from Italy) I ordered the Short Ribs, came with Polenta and my friend had the Papperdelle with brasied pork...Wonderful. Great dessert too..Service is always excellent..Only drawback, food is very rich, they use lots   of cream, butter, etc....Not good for a diet, but for a special meal that will be remembered.

data.title: Italian food at a great value
data.text: We have dined at Gianni's Italian Bistro for years and even when we moved from the area we still go there. Pastas are fresh and prepared just right. Entrée dishes are well executed. The wine list is comprehensive.

data.title: Pasta's are delicious!
data.text: I've been here a couple of times.  The food is always great.  Had the Polipo (grilled octopus and garbanzo beans) and is cooked perfectly.   The squid-ink spaghetti with clams also was marvelous.    A few service mishaps, especially around the wine.  Ordered an Italian Red from 2008, they brought a 2011, for the same price so I sent it back.  Ordered another from 2012 and they brought 2013.   I found it a little lazy to not update the menu and pricing accordingly.   The server needed to be taught a few minor details around 1) speaking to customers 2) placing silverware and glassware on the table, to not pour water across the laps of customers, 3) twist the wine bottle at the end of the pour of wine, etc.... Overall minor details and overlookable especially considering how good the food was....

data.title: Very nice!
data.text:
They have the BEST bread, service is spot on, food is very good, but it can be noisy.
Very popular neighborhood Italian restaurant in San Ramon.

data.title: Very goodfriendly neighborhood Italian restaurant with a conrinually updated menu..
data.text: We have been to Gianni's many times through its various names and locations and have always enjoyed the food and the service.  It is not often when you visit a local Italian restaurant in California whose entire wine list is Italian.  The service is always good, the staff is friendly, prices are reasonable and they do a good job of keeping the menu fresh--always with weekly specials and seasonal choices.  We'll be back..

data.title: Italy in our backyard
data.text: Always good food and good service. Small bistro with an intimate feeling. Local owners offer real Italian dishes, with specials that take you right to Italy.

data.title: Solid 4.5 stars
data.text: At first,  we thought we were driving into a diner parking lot. The outside is very simple and doesn't seem like much...but don't let the exterior fool you! The restaurant is very quaint and charming inside.  The staff is very friendly, and the food is excellent!  We started off with a couple small plates: the butrata and prosciutto and the octopus.  Both were amazing! I would order them as entrées!  I had the pork pappaedelle pasta and my fiance had the pasta in porcinni cream sauce. Both were fantastic.  We ended the night with the decadent pana cota. We had an excellent meal! We will definitely return.

data.title: Fantastic authentic Italian food with village flair
data.text: Nice local small business, run by local friendly couple. Excellent food, with nice wine list, and gnocchi is my personal favorite. Gianni and Melanie will not disappoint!

data.title: Don't let the outside fool you
data.text: When we first pulled up to the restaurant, I said "uh oh. What's the back-up plan?". It was my birthday, after all, and I could not imagine that this was going to even be worth the drive. I was so wrong. We had the wild mushroom ravioli and the gnocchi, followed by the panna cotta. It was possibly the best meal I'd had in years. We will absolutely be going back!

data.title: Very good restaurant, but at this level I expect table cloths, a less noisy environment, and a more detailed menu
data.text: The food and service are excellent and the portions are very generous.  I found the pasta sauce to be unusually spicy, which spiciness should have been indicated on the menu.  Prices for individual items are usual for a restaurant of this caliber in this area, so with 2 appetizers,  2 entrees, and 2 desserts (no alcohol or coffee), the bill with tax but before the tip was $90.

data.title: Good, interesting Italian food.
data.text: Have had a couple of different dishes there. The risotto is always good and they switch the type up on the menu. And I loved the Braised short ribs on polenta. Their menu does change so you can't be sure what you had once will be there again. Their desserts seem to always be good too.

data.title: Good First Experience at Gianni's
data.text: I dined for the first time with two friends at Gianni's this week, and overall it was a good experience. The staff, especially the hostess, were friendly, and my chicken breast with a creamy white sauce was very good. The caesar salad was excellent. My chocolate martini cocktail was different than most I have imbibed, and the polenta was pretty ordinary. The restaurant although not nearly full was quite noisy. It's difficult these days to find places where you can eat and easily speak with your friends and be heard.

data.title: Fabulous food from a chef with a heart!
data.text: Gianni's has some of the best Italian food I've ever had...even having been in Italy.  His gnocchi is fabulous.  But something you may not know is that every Monday he opens his restaurant to charities; he does the cooking and the charity provides the waitstaff.  All tips go to the charity as does a percentage of his profit from the evening.  He's a great, big-hearted, generous chef/owner and you can't go wrong with anything on his menu.

data.title: Small, cozy, Italian -- what's not to like?
data.text: We almost didn't go in because the restaurant looked like a dental office from the outside.  The decor on the inside is truly lovely (all warm colors, pictures on the walls, alcoves) and the food was rather good.  We split a burrata and a risotto.  With two glasses of wine, a desert and tip, we were about a benjamin into it, so it's not a dirt cheap place but the atmosphere, the food and the service make it worth it.

data.title: Authentic Italian
data.text: This place is "off the beaten path" in San Ramon, and unfortunately across the street from KFC, but I HIGHLY recommend giving it a try because you will not be sorry! The food far exceeded my expectations by being absolutely DELICIOUS and authentic Italian!  My visit was on a week night so it wasn't crowded or loud, but I was told the weekends can get busy so a reservation is recommended. I will be going back without a doubt because the Italian food is incredible!

data.title: Nice Italian restaurant
data.text: The food is amazing and they have some traditional Italian dishes. It's a vey small place so it can get noisy. But the owners are there all the time and are great people serving great food. And they have a full bar!

data.title: family style Italian
data.text: Took my family here for dinner and I thought it was very good. Service was great and everyone enjoyed their meals. It's nice family style restaurant. I would definitely go back.

data.title: The BEST Italian!!
data.text: This place isn't much to look at from the outside but inside you feel like you have stepped into a Tuscan restaurant in Florence!!  The food is outstanding!!  Great choices from pasta, beef, chicken, fish.  Gnocchi is fantastic.  Short ribs superb.  Make a reservation because it isn't that big and it is very popular!  Bon Appetit!!
